How This Site Works

2024-05-21

I wanted to understand every line of code on my site. Most frameworks are black boxes. I saw Justin Duke‚Äôs setup and thought: I can do that.

Stack

  • Bun: Replaces Node, npm, and webpack. Fast.
  • TypeScript: Types keep me honest.
  • Tailwind CSS: For styling. Gets out of the way.
  • Markdown-It: Markdown ‚Üí HTML.

No React. No hydration. No 500kb JavaScript bundles. Just HTML and CSS.

Build

Everything happens in src/build.ts. One file, top to bottom:

  1. Read markdown files from content/
  2. Extract frontmatter (title, date, ratings)
  3. Process markdown with custom rules:
    • Wikilinks: [[Page Name]] becomes internal linksStolen from Obsidian. I write everything in Obsidian anyway.
    • Footnotes: [^1] becomes expandable inline notes
  4. Find backlinks by scanning who links to whom
  5. Generate HTML using template strings
  6. Write to dist/

That‚Äôs it. No bundler, no transpiler, no magic.

Speed

The whole site builds in under a second:

$ bun run build

‚úÖ Build Complete!

I edit a file, run build, it‚Äôs done. No webpack. No dev server. I use Obsidian with a Git plugin, so commits happen automatically when I save.
